      • addFlightToOrder

        public boolean addFlightToOrder(int agentNumber,
                       java.lang.String customerPassport,
                       int orderNumber,
                       int flightNumber)
        This method add a new flight order to order. If the order is already exist in the customer's orders, than just add it to the existing order. If there no such order in the customer's orders, than create a new order and add it to customer's orders and agent's orders and associate this flight order with the flight and order.

        do not forget to set this customer as a responsible for this order.

        Parameters:
        agentNumber -
        customerPassport -
        orderNumber -
        flightNumber -
        Returns:
        true if the FlightOrder added successfully, false otherwise

        orderNumber -
        passportNumber -
        seat -
        row -

      • getPotentialCustomersForAgents

        public java.util.Map<Agent,java.util.List<Customer>> getPotentialCustomersForAgents()
        potential customers for Agents is a customer who lives in the same city where Agent lives but the customer never ordered from the agent. this method Retrieve > of agent with list of potential customers for each Agent IIF the Agent have any, otherwise the Agent will exclude from the map
        Returns:
        >

      • getPotentialCustomersForBranch

        public java.util.Map<Branch,java.util.List<Customer>> getPotentialCustomersForBranch()
        Retrieve Refugees - Potential customer for branch is a customer how lives in a city where IFly owns a branch but the customer never bought from it. This method return a Map with a list of potential customers for each branch. Warning: branch that as no such customers will not show up in your Map.
        Returns:
        map with potential customers for each branch

      • getFlightsSortedByOccupancy

        public java.util.PriorityQueue<java.util.Map.Entry<Flight,java.lang.Double>> getFlightsSortedByOccupancy()
        This method return all flights sorted by occupancy in an ascending order. Occupancy of flight: (number of occupied seats)/(airplane size) Hint: first get all flight into a map where value is the occupancy then try sorting the "Map.Entry" by using a proper data structure.
        Returns:
        priority queue of sorted flights and their occupancy

      • getAllThisSummerWorkEmployeesSortedBySeniority

        public java.util.List<Employee> getAllThisSummerWorkEmployeesSortedBySeniority()
        This method find all this year summer workers and sort them by their seniority in a descending order. This year summer workers are workers that have more than 0 number of this year summer assignments.
        Returns:
        list of employees
        See Also:
        Employee.getNumberOfThisYearSummerAssignments()

      • getBranchesAgentsSortedByRating

        public java.util.Map<Branch,java.util.ArrayList<Agent>> getBranchesAgentsSortedByRating()
        This method return for each branch a list of agents working in it. The agents list is sorted by agent rating, if two agents have the same rating, than sort them by their number of assignment each of them need to do on this summer. Hint: build for each branch in the hashMap a new sorting array list. Use a comparator that answer the sorting mission and sort the array list before you put it in the hashMap.
        Returns:
        map of agents as a value of branch keys

      • findTheBestFlightBack

        public java.util.List<Flight> findTheBestFlightBack(int flightNumberSource,
                                           int vacationDays)
        This method find the best flight back. The given flight number belong to the source flight and now, by using this flight details and vacation time, you need to find flight back from the given flight destination to the given flight source. The returning flight have to return between: (given flight destination date) + (vacationDays) - 1 TO (given flight destination date) + (vacationDays) + 1. Best flight means: the flight back with minimum steps (stops) includes. If this method (findTheBestFlightBack) didn't find a direct flight, than you need to search for a connection flight (contains exactly 2 flights no more no less) with a helper method:
        Parameters:
        flightNumberSource -
        vacationDays -
        Returns:
        list of flights - because if we call the helper method, we need to return list of two flights
        See Also:
        getPairFlightsBack(core.Flight, java.util.Date, java.util.Date)

      • getPairFlightsBack

        private java.util.List<Flight> getPairFlightsBack(Flight incomeFlight,
                                        java.util.Date minRange,
                                        java.util.Date maxRange)
        This is a helper method for the method - findTheBestFlightBack. This method gets the income flight and two dates that represents range to find flights back. the method will take apart when there is no direct flight back. You need to find exactly two flights, that their connection is at the same day (e.g: flight1 lands in 1.1.2015 and flight2 soars in 1.1.2015). The chosen pair of flights back has to be the pair with the minimum number of stops (sum of the first and the second flight's stops).
        Parameters:
        incomeFlight -
        minRange - - the minimum edge for soars
        maxRange - - the maximum edge for soars
        Returns:
        List of two flights {firstFlight, secondFlight}
